byline.original: By KATHARINE Q. SEELYE and JESS BIDGOOD

abstract: Hundreds of thousands of people attend South Boston St Patrick's Day Parade and celebrate new chapter in parade's storied tradition as it opens its ranks for first time to gays and lesbians; ban on participation of gay groups had turned parade into battleground for gay-rights movement.
lead_paragraph: Thousands of people celebrated a new chapter in the city’s history on Sunday as the storied South Boston St. Patrick’s Day Parade opened its ranks for the first time to gays and lesbians.

headline.main: Boston Celebrates End of Ban as Gays March in St. Patrick’s Parade
headline.print_headline: Boston Celebrates End of Ban as Gays March in St. Patrick’s Parade

snippet: Thousands of people celebrated a new chapter in the city’s history on Sunday as the storied South Boston St. Patrick’s Day Parade opened its ranks for the first time to gays and lesbians.
